meanings.definition: Having a stronger taste or smell of mint.
meanings.sent1: The gum was mintier than the candy.
meanings.sent2: The toothpaste was mintier than the mouthwash.
meanings.sent3: She felt like a walking mintier garden after chewing all that gum.
meanings.sent4: The air in the room was mintier than a winter breeze.
meanings.sent5: The tea was so mintier that it felt like a cool breeze in a cup.

meanings.sent1: This gum is mintier than the last one.
meanings.sent2: The new toothpaste is mintier than the old one.
meanings.sent3: He joked that his breath was mintier than a fresh mint leaf.
meanings.sent4: The scent of the candle was mintier than a field of peppermints.
meanings.sent5: The ice cream was so mintier that it felt like a frozen mint leaf melting on the tongue.

meanings.definition: More fresh or invigorating, like mint.
meanings.sent1: The mintier air outside was a welcome change from the stuffy room.
meanings.sent2: The mintier breeze made her feel more awake.
meanings.sent3: He sprayed the mintier perfume to feel as fresh as a mint leaf.
meanings.sent4: The mintier taste of the drink woke up his taste buds.
meanings.sent5: The mintier scent of the flowers was like a breath of fresh air in the room.
